final_answer:
The humor and satire in the image stem from the juxtaposition of the t-shirt's message with the scene depicted. The shirt quotes a line from "Fight Club" that criticizes consumerism and the futility of working jobs one dislikes for meaningless purchases. However, the person wearing the shirt is shown sitting at a desk, presumably working a typical office job, which seems to contradict the rebellious, anti-establishment sentiment of the quote.

This contrast highlights the irony of professing anti-consumerist beliefs while participating in the very system being criticized. The text "YES, BUT" further emphasizes this contradiction, underscoring the gap between ideals and reality in a playful, satirical manner.
